results.title: Effects of selected antihypertensives and analgesics on hepatic porphyrin accumulation: implications for clinical porphyria.
results.text_hl: These studies suggest that @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Porphyria_Acute_Intermittent</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017118 @@@acute porphyrias@@@ may be at greater risk for developing @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@porphyric attacks@@@ when treated with @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@ (compared with @CHEMICAL_Diltiazem @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004110 @@@diltiazem@@@), @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ (compared with @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@), and @CHEMICAL_Tramadol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014147 @@@tramadol@@@ (compared with the other analgesics).

citations.NLM: Lambrecht RW, Gildemeister OS, Williams A, Pepe JA, Tortorelli KD, Bonkovsky HL. Effects of selected antihypertensives and analgesics on hepatic porphyrin accumulation: implications for clinical porphyria. Biochem Pharmacol. 1999 Sep 1;58(5):887-96. PMID: 10449201
